text: Leverett Sherman Baldwin (October 28, 1839 - October 14, 1897) was an American politician. Baldwin was born in Hinesburg, Vermont. He lived in Mattoon, Illinois and worked for the Illinois and St. Louis Railroad. He served in the Illinois House of Representatives from 1893 to 1895. Baldwin was a Democrat. He died at his home in Mattoon, Illinois after suffering a stroke.'Souvenir of the Illinois Legislature of 1893,' J.L. Pickering, Springfield, Illinois: 1893, Biographical Sketch of Leverett Baldwin, pg. 44'Died Yesterday L.S. Baldwin Succumbs to Disease,' The Mattoon Gazette, (Illinois), October 15, 1897, pg. 5 ==Notes== ==External links== * Category:1839 births Category:1897 deaths Category:People from Hinesburg, Vermont Category:People from Mattoon, Illinois Category:Illinois Democrats Category:Members of the Illinois House of Representatives Category:19th-century American politicians
title: Leverett Baldwin
